intro: Boechera selbyi var. thorneae, commonly known as the Thorne's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial species typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring. The plant has a low, mat-like growth habit and is characterized by its hairy leaves and sturdy, branching stems.
